title: Colsen Gatten Commits to Duke: 2026 LB Recruit
text:
Pittsburgh LB Colsen Gatten Commits to Duke for 2026 Season Durham,N.C. – Duke University has secured a verbal commitment from Colsen Gatten, a highly-regarded linebacker from Pittsburgh Central Catholic high School, for the 2026 football season. Gatten, a high-three-star recruit, announced his decision Wednesday, choosing the Blue Devils over a host of other Power Five offers.
Gatten’s Journey to Duke Gatten’s recruitment gained momentum after receiving an offer from Penn State in June 2023, when current Duke Head Coach Manny Diaz was the defensive coordinator for the Nittany Lions. Diaz continued to pursue Gatten upon his arrival at Duke in December 2023, extending a scholarship offer in January 2024.
The 6-foot-1, 205-pound linebacker also had scholarship offers from major programs, including Notre Dame, Michigan, and Tennessee. Pro Tip: Keep an eye on Gatten’s development; linebackers frequently enough make significant strides between their junior and senior years.
A pipeline from Pittsburgh Central Catholic Duke’s acquisition of Gatten marks the second consecutive year they have successfully recruited a linebacker from Pittsburgh Central Catholic. Bradley Gompers,a four-star prospect,joined the Blue Devils in the 2025 class,establishing a clear connection between the two programs.
The Blue Devils have been actively recruiting in Pennsylvania, signing four total prospects from the state in the 2025 cycle.
Gatten’s Impact and Future with the Blue Devils Gatten’s commitment adds to Duke’s already growing 2026 class, bringing the total to seven commitments. Did You Know? Collage football recruiting rankings can significantly influence a team’s performance and future success.
As a junior in 2024, Gatten played a pivotal role in Central Catholic’s impressive 12-3 season, which included a Western Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic League (WPIAL) 6A championship and a runner-up finish in the Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic Association (PIAA) 6A state championship game.
Gatten has visited Durham multiple times, further solidifying his decision to join the Blue Devils. His official visit date to Duke is not yet public.
Offer Summary Besides Duke and Penn State, Colsen Gatten has received scholarship offers from:
Boston College California Cincinnati Indiana Kentucky Louisville Maryland Michigan michigan State Nebraska Notre Dame Oklahoma Pittsburgh SMU Syracuse Tennessee Texas A&M Virginia Tech Wake Forest west Virginia Wisconsin He took an official visit to Pitt during the weekend of June 6 through June 8, and previously had an official visit planned to Indiana.

Gatten’s Legacy Although Gatten’s father, Aaron Gatten, played for Penn State, Colsen is steadfast to build his own legacy at Duke.
The Importance of Linebackers in Modern Football Linebackers are the quarterbacks of the defense, responsible for reading plays, making tackles, and providing leadership on the field. their versatility is crucial in today’s fast-paced game.
Run Stopping: Linebackers must be able to effectively fill gaps and make tackles to prevent opposing teams from gaining significant yardage on the ground. Pass Coverage: With the rise of spread offenses, linebackers must be adept at covering running backs and tight ends in passing situations. Blitzing: Linebackers are often used as blitzers to pressure the quarterback and disrupt the opposing team’s passing game.
